title: Display health in client UI
description:
Walking skeleton spec says 'spawn colored rectangle with name label and health number'. Currently Health component exists but isn't displayed - only EntityName is rendered.

Update spawn_labels_for_entities to show 'Name (HP: X)' format.

title: Handle message channel send failures gracefully
description:
In create_entity handler, message send failure is silently ignored with 'let _ ='. If engine is down, user sees success but entity doesn't appear in game. Non-programmers won't understand why.

Options:
- Log warning on send failure
- Return HTTP response indicating 'saved but hot reload unavailable'
- Add monitoring for failed sends

title: Resolve agent concerns: extract storage/engine/editor crates
description:
Addressed concerns raised by mission-lead, architect, and bevy agents during walking skeleton retrospective:

- Created roguebench-storage with ContentStore trait (SQLite + Memory impls)
- Created roguebench-engine with EnginePlugin structure
- Created roguebench-editor with axum HTTP handlers
- Typed EditorMessage channel in protocol
- Added storage roundtrip tests

Server main.rs reduced from ~280 lines to ~65 lines of pure orchestration.
close_reason: Completed: storage, engine, editor crates extracted. Tests pass. Architecture matches docs/stack.md.

title: Improve error handling in production code paths
description:
Several production code paths use unwrap()/expect() that could crash:
- Mutex lock().unwrap() in storage (both SqliteStore and MemoryStore)
- Runtime::new().unwrap() in server main
- TcpListener::bind().expect() in editor

Should propagate errors properly or use expect() with meaningful messages.

title: First walking skeleton: determine and implement
description:
Identify and build the first vertical slice that proves end-to-end integration.

Criteria for the skeleton:
- Touches all layers (editor → API → storage → runtime)
- Can be demonstrated working
- Proves the integration path before investing in depth

Candidate workflows from docs/mission.md:
- Define a new enemy type (set stats, choose behavior, see it spawn)
- Create a room layout (place tiles, set spawns, play through)
- Script a simple behavior (enemy patrols, door opens on trigger)

The actual choice should emerge from what's most valuable to prove first.
close_reason: Walking skeleton proven: entity names flow end-to-end (browser → HTTP API → SQLite → Engine reload → Lightyear → Client rendering). All layers touched, demonstrable, integration validated.

title: Add editor HTTP handler tests
description:
The editor crate has a nicely factored router() function that accepts dependencies. Add tests using MemoryStore + test channel.

Handlers to test:
- list_entities
- create_entity
- index (HTML response)

Deferral-guard flagged this as low-effort, high-value.
close_reason: Added 4 HTTP handler tests: index_returns_html, list_entities_empty_initially, create_entity_returns_201_and_sends_message, list_entities_returns_created_entities. Tests use MemoryStore and verify message channel sends.

title: Add input validation for entity creation
description:
No validation on name (empty? length?) or health (negative? overflow?). HTML 'required' is client-side only. Bad data goes straight to storage.

Per mission: users should 'experiment safely (can't break the system)'.

Minimum: name non-empty, health >= 0, return 400 with explanation.

title: Add health stat to entity workflow
description:
Add health: i32 to EntityDef and flow it end-to-end through storage, editor API, and engine. This is the thinnest increment that lets non-programmers author meaningful stats.

Touches:
- roguebench-core: Add health field to EntityDef
- roguebench-storage: Update schema for health column
- roguebench-editor: Update API to accept health
- roguebench-engine: Receive health on reload

Verification:
- Create entity with health=50 via editor
- Verify storage contains health value
- Verify engine receives health on reload
close_reason: Implemented: health flows end-to-end (core->storage->editor->protocol->engine). All tests pass. Pattern established for adding future fields.

title: Add delete/edit UI for entities
description:
Users can create entities but cannot delete or edit them. Per mission, users need to 'experiment safely' and 'iterate through trial and error'. The storage layer already has delete_entity() - need UI buttons and edit endpoint.

Blocks: User workflow iteration

title: Add engine Bevy system tests
description:
The engine crate has no unit tests. Testing Bevy systems requires design consideration:

Options:
1. Full Bevy App integration tests
2. SystemState-based unit tests
3. Mock-based approach

Systems to test:
- spawn_server
- initial_load
- check_editor_messages
- reload_entities
- log_connections

Deferral-guard allowed deferral: core logic delegates to already-tested ContentStore.
close_reason: Added 3 Bevy system tests: reload_entities_spawns_from_storage, reload_entities_despawns_existing, check_editor_messages_triggers_reload. Tests use minimal App with MemoryStore, verifying entity spawn/despawn lifecycle and channel message handling.
